means: （尤指因行为不很明智）使陷入危险

sentence.Network_en: Mr Clarke has shown himself to be resolutely opposed to compromise.
sentence.Network_cn: 克拉克先生已表示自己坚决反对妥协。

sentence.Network_en: He would rather shoot himself than compromise his principles.
sentence.Network_cn: 他宁愿一枪打死自己也不愿违背自己的原则。

sentence.Network_en: Their problem can only be solved in a spirit of compromise.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的问题只能通过妥协来解决。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting mutual consent to arbitration): from Old French compromis, from late Latin compromissum 'a consent to arbitration', neuter past participle of compromittere, from com- 'together' + promittere (see promise)

entry.def: A compromise is a situation in which people accept something slightly different from what they really want, because of circumstances or because they are considering the wishes of other people.

example.ex: Encourage your child to reach a compromise between what he wants and what you want...
example.tran: 鼓励孩子在他的愿望和你的愿望之间找到一个折中点。

example.ex: Be ready and willing to make compromises between your needs and those of your partner...
example.tran: 时刻准备好并乐意在自己与伴侣的需求之间作出让步。

entry.def: If you compromise with someone, you reach an agreement with them in which you both give up something that you originally wanted. You can also say that two people or groups compromise .

example.ex: The government has compromised with its critics over monetary policies...
example.tran: 政府已经就货币政策向批评人士作出让步。

example.ex: 'Nine,' said I. 'Nine thirty,' tried he. We compromised on 9.15...
example.tran: “9点。”我说。“9点半。”他试着说。于是我们各让一步，定在了9点一刻。

entry.tran: 使（自己）声誉受损;违背(信念)
entry.def: If someone compromises themselves or compromises their beliefs, they do something which damages their reputation for honesty, loyalty, or high moral principles.

example.ex: ...members of the government who have compromised themselves by co-operating with the emergency committee...
example.tran: 因与紧急委员会合作而使自己名誉受损的政府成员

example.ex: He would rather shoot himself than compromise his principles.
example.tran: 他宁愿一枪打死自己也不愿违背自己的原则。

means.word_mean: 1. a middle way between two extremes
2. an accommodation in which both sides make concessions;

sentences.sentence: "the newly elected congressmen rejected a compromise because they considered it `business as usual'"

means.word_mean: 1. make a compromise; arrive at a compromise;

sentences.sentence: "nobody will get everything he wants; we all must compromise"

means.word_mean: 3. expose or make liable to danger, suspicion, or disrepute;

sentences.sentence: "The nuclear secrets of the state were compromised by the spy"

auth_sentence.content: But all attempts to find a compromise have failed.
auth_sentence.res_content: But all attempts to find a compromise have failed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But all attempts to find a compromise have failed.

auth_sentence.content: I'm going to compromise with him, though.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm going to compromise with him, though.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm going to compromise with him, though.

auth_sentence.content: Republicans think compromise means total abandonment of those bills.
auth_sentence.res_content: Republicans think compromise means total abandonment of those bills.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Republicans think compromise means total abandonment of those bills.

Sentence.sentence: The technologically compromised space shuttle program has just come to an end, with no successor.
They often compromise by having just one child.
Why do many women in rich countries compromise by having only one child

sentences.en: The spokesman made it clear that no compromise was yet in sight.
sentences.cn: 发言人表明, 目前还不会妥协。

sentences.en: They compromised by going to the cinema.
sentences.cn: 他们采取折中的办法去看电影。

sentences.en: I am prepared to make some concession on minor details, but I cannot compromise on fundamentals.
sentences.cn: 在一些细节上我可以作些让步，但在基本原则上我是不会妥协的。

means.word_mean: 连累, 危害, 损害

sentences.en: Such conduct will compromise your reputation.
sentences.cn: 这些举动将会损害你的名誉。

sentences.en: He refused to compromise his principles.
sentences.cn: 他对他的原则寸步不让。

jushi.english: The spokesman made it clear that no compromise was yet in sight.
jushi.chinese: 发言人表明,目前还不会妥协。

jushi.english: There is no question that a new compromise will be reached.
jushi.chinese: 新的妥协毫无疑问地会达成。

jushi.english: Both of them are too stubborn to agree a compromise.
jushi.chinese: 他们两个都太固执,都不同意一项折中办法。
